body.p: A network port is used to model the output of a network interface on a given material. Each port is characterized by a number, a name, a type of interface (for exemple 100 full duplex), an IP address and MAC address as well as a subnet mask, bridge, and a gateway. Finally it is possible to associate a port to a network jack.
On this port, you can add one or more VLAN, the latter can be defined by a name, a comment and a VLAN number (ID TAG).
body.note: For a network port of an object type computers, select the MAC field from the drop down list to select the MAC address of the component type network card.
body.p: Network connections are made by connecting two ports between items. To connect two devices together there must be a free port on each of these items. In most configurations, connections will be between a port on a computer, device, or a printer and a port on a network device (hub, switch).
For each material, it is possible at any time to add one or more ports through the massive update system.
